home.title: Red Pandas
home.content: A design project aimed to bring awareness to the endangered red pandas through education. Hope you enjoy!

about.title: About
about.content1: Red pandas are endangered mammals native to the eastern Himalayas and southwestern China.
about.content2: They have reddish-brown fur, long, shaggy tails, and a slight waddle due to their shorter front legs.
about.content3: They're roughly the size of a cat, though with longer bodies, and somewhat heavier.
about.content4: Bamboo being their main source of food, alongside eggs, birds, and insects.

fact1.title: On hinds
fact1.content: When red pandas feel provoked they often stand on their hind legs to appear large and 'threatening'.

fact2.title: Extra thumb
fact2.content: Like giant pandas, red pandas have an extra “thumb,” which is an enlarged bone for grabbing tree branches and bamboo stems.

fact3.title: Lying high
fact3.content: They sleep stretched out high on branches with legs dangling when it is hot, and curled up into their tail when it's cold.

threat1.title: Poaching
threat1.content: Red pandas are often hunted and captured in order to be sold to private collectors, zoos, and kept as pets.

threat2.title: Habitat loss
threat2.content: Deforestation and habitat loss is the number one threat facing red pandas. They can't survive without a home.

blocks.title: In 2003
blocks.content: Four captive-bred red pandas were successfully released into the wild.

blocks.title: In 2004
blocks.content: Firefox starts using a red panda as their logo and mascot.

blocks.title: In 2008
blocks.content: Red pandas were listed as endangered.

blocks.title: In 2013
blocks.content: A red panda called Rusty escapes the National Zoo.

project1.title: Conservation
project1.content:
